channel.title: Wont let anymore people in
channel.description:
my server works fine for abit.. untill i get 12 people on. it never lets more than 12 people on :mad: then after 12 people are on it starts logging players out and not letting any one back in like its offline even tho some people are still playing, and its really annoying because i have to restart it evrey 5 mins and i dont know why it happens can anyone please help.
also it has never done this before it only started doing a few days ago and i have had more than 12 players before it started doing this.

item.title: Wont let anymore people in
item.dc:creator: @ven0m ven0m
item.description:
@ven0m wrote:

i think its on 0

Read full topic

item.title: Wont let anymore people in
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

Consult someone with experience with those, i have no distinctive experience in those particular javas and classes, and I could just as easily mess something up as you could. I would venture a guess however if the antilag.java contains a timer for auto-restart or update to prevent lag, you should probably set it to something very high.

Read full topic

item.title: Wont let anymore people in
item.dc:creator: @ven0m ven0m
item.description:
@ven0m wrote:

hmm i have antilag.java and antilag.class what should i do? and where can i find the auto-updater

Read full topic

item.title: Wont let anymore people in
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

Auto-updaters sometimes have that effect. They are programmed to restart a server every once in awile, but instead of kicking everyone off. it waits for them to log off voluntarily but refuses their connection. it may be a server.java problem again. You’d have to check what the auto-update is set to… and make sure you don’t have an anti-lag protocol running that’s causing it as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Wont let anymore people in
item.dc:creator: @ven0m ven0m
item.description:
@ven0m wrote:

oh i understand now, no its not that it hapens to evrey one even me. and i have to keep restarting the server evrey 5 mins just so people can get back on

Read full topic

item.title: Wont let anymore people in
item.dc:creator: @Click_Here Click Here
item.description:
@Click_Here wrote:

also, watch that they dont use the command ::setitem… bad command. instantly ip banns.

Read full topic

item.title: Wont let anymore people in
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

Accounts get corrupted in a variety of ways. The most easily being that they ::noclip into an area that freezes them and disconnects them, and they are stuck there. the only way to fix it. is to go to character files and change their logout coords. the second way is they have an equipped item that the server doesn’t recognize and it corrupts them, again character files and manually remove the ring. I can think of no other reason it denys connections after they log out.

Read full topic

item.title: Wont let anymore people in
item.dc:creator: @ven0m ven0m
item.description:
@ven0m wrote:

they’re accounts arent getting corrupted? and it happens to me aswell? can u help?

Read full topic

item.title: Wont let anymore people in
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

that’s a whole nother ball game entirely. Make sure they didn’t accidently get banned for using wrong commands, or make sure they’re accounts aren’t getting corrupted. It’s usually not a server issue and I mean server.java issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Wont let anymore people in
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

as much as you think your bandwidth can handle. I’d suggest for a home PC with a DSL/cable connection maximum 20 people. if your using anything slower than DSL you shouldn’t even be hosting a server. lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Wont let anymore people in

item.description:
@ven0m wrote:

how much larger

Read full topic

item.title: Wont let anymore people in
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

go to server.java scroll down to bottom (usually)

until you see this. replace the number after the equal to something larger, should fix it.

public static int MaxConnections = 100000;

Read full topic
